intro: Hieracium mrkvickanum, commonly known as the Mrkvicka's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has hairy stems and leaves with a serrated edge, and its yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Hieracium mrkvickanum is often considered a weed due to its aggressive growth and ability to colonize various environments.
